attributes.action: The PM and members of Cabinet should be required to publish their tax returns
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister himself said before Christmas 2022 that he would be publishing his tax return but, at the time of writing, still hasn’t done so.  A law requiring the Prime Minister and all members of Cabinet to publish their tax returns annually would mean that we would not have to rely on individual promises.
attributes.background: Parliament should introduce legislation that would require the Prime Minister and all members of the Cabinet to publish their tax returns annually. Such a law would go a long way in restoring trust in our politicians and in politics more widely.
